source: How clean are electric cars? A briefing by Transport & Environment, April 2020
assumptions: Fuel consumption based on https://spritmonitor.de. Small cars (B-segment): Ford Fiesta, Peugeot 208, Renault Zoe. Medium cars (C-segment): VW Golf and ID3, Nissan Qashqai and Leaf. Large car (D-segment): VW Passat, BMW 3-series, Tesla Model 3 and Y, Mercedes EQC. Executive car (E-segment): Audi A6/A7, Volvo XC90, Tesla Model S/X. high mileage cars: Large cars used for Taxi/Uber/etc services, 30-40000 km/year. Production, not including battery: 4.8tCO2/kg in 2020, 2.9tCO2/kg. Lifetime mileage: Small cars 170000km, Medium cars 225000km, Large cars 280000km, Executive cars 335000km, High mileage csrs: 500000km. Well-to-tank emissions: 735gCO2/l diesel, 614gCO2/l gasoline. Electricity grid loss: 7%. Charging loss: 10%
